intro: Lasianthaea gentryi, commonly known as the Gentry's lasianthaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
